result.execSummary:
The defendant Daroyl C Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay the related surcharge and pay Court costs and victim/ witness surcharges; to be collected by the DOC from up to 25% of prison funds with balance to be paid by 07-02-2021.   
Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: with Count 2, but consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant advised that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms and may not vote in  any election until his civil rights are restored.

NO CONTACT with Paul B. or Davell Y.  
NO alcohol.  
NO controlled substances.

Mental Health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.   
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking behavioral Modification program.  
NO drivers license suspension.   

Restitution set at $0.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 1, but consecutive to any other sentence with 15 days credit

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS 6 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2, credit for 15 days.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 1, credit for 15 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/2/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/2/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Paul B or Davell Y
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Justice Point Reort received and filed. sab

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 7/2/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent. Nick Cerwin for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
On motion of the State, Court added "As a Party to a Crime", pursuant to WIs State 939.05.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Louis Epps for Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Ron Dague for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
